message:
Asking doubts is a part of learning, so with the launch of CodeX, we will be glad to help everyone with their queries.

fb.com/groups/CodeXKGP

CodeX brought to you by CodeStash, IIT Kharagputr.

Greetings on behalf of Nurture.AI. We are pleased to inform you that Nurture.AI will be conducting AI Saturdays in Kharagpur. As we all know, that Artificial Intelligence is the new talk all over the world; why should Kharagpur stay behind! In this exciting initiative,  open and free for all AI sessions will be conducted in Kharagpur. This will be conducted in sync with a worldwide audience across the United States, Singapore, and other Indian cities. Each session every Saturday will be divided into 3 parts where we will implement AI algorithms, discuss research papers, online material and have some interesting discussions. 

The session will have a preliminary understanding of Python as a must and here are some resources to help you with that:
https://www.dataquest.io/  for a good guided Python introduction explanations and exercises: (Intro to Python available on free plan)

Python refresher + numpy+ matplotlib by Stanford (https://github.com/kuleshov/cs228-material/blob/master/tutorials/python/cs228-python-tutorial.ipynb)

Pandas tutorials(https://bitbucket.org/hrojas/learn-pandas)

We are very glad to be a part of this and hope you too will benefit from this initiative. 
The first session will be in January(tentatively on 13th January). All those interested kindly fill the registration form given below. The details regarding the sessions will be shared with the registered students soon. Also, this being a student initiative we request all interested research scholars and seniors to mentor us and help us make it a grand success. 

Let us all join this wave of change and be a part of a global community comprising eminent researchers, PhDs, and students. 

Sign-Up form:
https://goo.gl/forms/AluX7UZLVFL5bgIg1

For more details, contact:
Subham Rajgaria: 9830331068
Siddharth Singh: 8826219130

CodeClub, IIT Kharagpur presents to you CodeNite 2.0. This CodeNite is meant to help you stay in touch with coding during the holidays. This time we will be having individual participation to help you boost your individual coding skills. Expect the questions to be even more interesting this time though.
Mark the date!
Date: 10th December, 2017
Time: 9pm to 12am
https://www.hackerearth.com/challenge/college/codenite-2/

Technex-IIT (BHU) Varanasi presents the Kogence Simulation Challenge – a unique simulation hackathon supported by Amazon Web Services, NVIDIA and VMWare with cloud supercomputing platform support from Kogence, lucrative internship offers and $35,000 worth of prizes. Try your hands on simulations based on the leading technologies behind AI – Tensorflow, Keras, Scikit learn and Torch – in the Artificial Intelligence Challenge. Signup at https://kogence.com/app and register for the challenge at https://kogence.com/app/landing/challenges . Follow Kogence at https://www.linkedin.com/company/kogence and https://twitter.com/kogence .

Hurry Up! As the last date for registration is 15th November!

Are you the one who loves to code...
Then time to get yourself grooved for action...
The much awaited coding event is back with a bang...
Presenting to you...
"IEMCO" (IEM Coding Olympiad 2017 November Challenge)
With an exciting prize money of Rs 50,000 up for grab
you get a chance to win the ultimate title of Olympiad Champion,
So, Guys and Girls, what are you waiting for...
Date : 4thNovember,2017
Time : 8:00 - 11:00 p.m.
Contest Link : www.codechef.com/IEMCO4
Hurry up, Register now!!!!!
Contact : 
Prof. Tapan Kumar Hazra(9830362799)
Prof. Sayantan Rana(9903246316)
Shubham Bajaj (8276901300)
Visit us at : www.facebook.com/iem.iemco
Mail us at : iemco@iemcal.com
Hoping to see all the passionate coders and algorithmic minds battling it out on the D-Day...
#IEMCO #Coding

I'm reaching out because I'm the co-ordinator of India’s biggest community hackathon called InOut. The fourth edition of InOut is happening in the “Silicon Valley of India”, Bangalore on 7th - 8th Oct. It's a great opportunity to interact with like minded folks and engineers from companies like Google, Facebook, IBM, GitHub, Cloudflare, GitLab etc. We would love to have active participation from IIT KHARAGPUR Developer Community. Apply now - https://hackinout.co

Please share the post in your group

We are excited to announce the acceptance of the research paper, "Soft Seeded SSL Graphs for Unsupervised Semantic Similarity-based Retrieval", which is an independent research by 4th year undergraduates as a short paper in CIKM 2017 International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management.

CSURG hopes to continue working with more undergraduates, and looks forward to growing participation.

We are excited to announce the acceptance of the research paper, "Soft Seeded SSL Graphs for Unsupervised Semantic Similarity-based Retrieval", which is an independent research by 4th year undergraduates as a short paper in CIKM 2017 International Conference on Information and Knowledge Management.

CSURG hopes to continue working with more undergraduates, and looks forward to growing participation.

Registration open here - https://goo.gl/DXz2LG

With the aim to make Computer Science research at IIT Kharagpur more inclusive, we seek to share and discuss some of the distinguished results and insights from work of research scholars, starting from the recent work on a new temporal model for evolving citation networks.

This work by research scholars Mayank Singh & Rajdeep Sarkar and Prof. Pawan Goyal, Prof. Animesh Mukherjee has been accepted to ACM SIGKDD 2017, one of the top CS conference in the area of Data Mining; in-fact being the only paper from India to get accepted to KDD. The attached video provides a concise summary of the model and results, and is also in competition with other accepted works wrt total views, so please do make sure to watch and share! 

As a fundamental goal of CSURG is to initiate and foster research interest at an early stage for undergrads, we'll also be looking forward to work towards providing an overview of such excellent work in a way that requires low background-knowledge on reader's part 😀!

Full paper is available at https://arxiv.org/pdf/1609.08371.pdf

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fhGewF4Xyo0&feature=youtu.be

With the aim to make Computer Science research at IIT Kharagpur more inclusive, we seek to share and discuss some of the distinguished results and insights from work of research scholars, starting from the recent work on a new temporal model for evolving citation networks.

This work by research scholars Mayank Singh & Rajdeep Sarkar and Prof. Pawan Goyal, Prof. Animesh Mukherjee has been accepted to ACM SIGKDD 2017, one of the top CS conference in the area of Data Mining; in-fact being the only paper from India to get accepted to KDD. The attached video provides a concise summary of the model and results, and is also in competition with other accepted works wrt total views, so please do make sure to watch and share! 

As a fundamental goal of CSURG is to initiate and foster research interest at an early stage for undergrads, we'll also be looking forward to work towards providing an overview of such excellent work in a way that requires low background-knowledge on reader's part 😀!

Full paper is available at https://arxiv.org/pdf/1609.08371.pdf

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fhGewF4Xyo0&feature=youtu.be

What is the destiny of your research paper? Is it going to be increasingly popular OR shall it lose its popularity as time passes by? What other papers would gain from the loss of this popularity?  

We answer some of these interesting questions in our work on modeling how the flow of citations, coming to a paper, is diverted to other research papers. This work has been accepted among 131 (out of 748 submissions) research ideas from all around the globe in one of the top CS conferences in the area of Data Mining and Data Sciences (ACM SIGKDD 2017). This is the ONLY work from India that got through this time in SIGKDD. 

In this work, we talk about how research papers that get older by time lose their potential citations. We prove that new papers that cite these older papers steal the incoming citations. We also prove that this stealing (or relaying from the old to the new) effect becomes more prominent as time passes by. 

Please help our team to compete with others in having maximum view count of our Youtube video. WATCH, LIKE and SHARE it to your friends as much as possible. Make it the MOST WATCHED VIDEO among all projects.

What is the destiny of your research paper? Is it going to be increasingly popular OR shall it lose its popularity as time passes by? What other papers would gain from the loss of this popularity?  

We answer some of these interesting questions in our work on modeling how the flow of citations, coming to a paper, is diverted to other research papers. This work has been accepted among 131 (out of 748 submissions) research ideas from all around the globe in one of the top CS conferences in the area of Data Mining and Data Sciences (ACM SIGKDD 2017). This is the ONLY work from India that got through this time in SIGKDD. 

In this work, we talk about how research papers that get older by time lose their potential citations. We prove that new papers that cite these older papers steal the incoming citations. We also prove that this stealing (or relaying from the old to the new) effect becomes more prominent as time passes by. 

Please help our team to compete with others in having maximum view count of our Youtube video. WATCH, LIKE and SHARE it to your friends as much as possible. Make it the MOST WATCHED VIDEO among all projects.

With an exciting time ahead for high impact research in CS, the Computer Science Undergraduate Research Group marks a new initiative for cultivating a culture of research and innovation among undergrads and bringing them together with the community of grad students and professors early in their academic career.

In its pilot-testing phase, CSURG achieves tremendous success with acceptance of the research paper "Social Media Advertisement Outreach: Learning the Role of Aesthetics" to ACM SIGIR 2017, renowned as the world's most prestigious conference in Information Retrieval. The work comes from the independent effort of 4 third year undergrads, Avikalp Srivastava, Madhav Datt, Jaikrishna Ch & Shubham Mangla and highlights the potential of research at the undergraduate level that remains untapped at most Indian universities.

With this success, CSURG is now growing, and hopes to induct highly motivated undergrads, and work closely with with PhD scholars, CNERG - Complex Networks Research Group, IIT Kharagpur and research groups with an aim to mentor and familiarise students with research at an early stage, and enable them to publish high quality and impact work to top-tier conferences and journals.

All of us at CSURG are extremely excited about working with undergraduates and are looking forward to an enthusiastic participation. Cheers!

Hey, everyone!

Mr. Robert Smith, co-founder & COO of infofree.com and Salesflower.com, one of the leading companies in US on sales leads, contacts and business solutions in this area, will be giving a talk on 22nd and 23rd on the below mentioned topics.

The schedule is as follows:
Talk 1: 22nd March 2017 (Wed, 6:30-7:30 PM) 
Topic: The Dangers of Technology Frameworks
Speaker: Mr. Robert Smith
Audience: CSE/Maths (All students)
Venue: CSE Classroom CSE-119

Talk 2: 23nd March 2017 (Thu, 6:30-7:30 PM) 
Topic: Wholistic Big Data in Business
Speaker: Mr. Robert Smith
Audience: CSE/Maths (All students)
Venue: CSE Classroom CSE-119

As part of your courses and general industrial experience, you will find these topics informant and extremely relevant. He is a person who has been at the helm of his companies where emerging technologies and develpment procedures using them are concerned. This will be a nice add-on to your Software Development and Database Course knowledge from the point of the industry, so do attend and bring your friends too.

story: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared DoSelect's photo.
message: Code Club, IIT Kharagpur shared DoSelect's photo. Tata Communications, in association with DoSelect, is bringing forth a coding battle like none other! For all you brilliant minds across the country who are looking for an arena to etch your mark in, we have just the right affair coming up! Here's a call to round up all the gallant ones out there to sweat it out on the hacking battlefield this March. After all, this is Spartaaaaa!! Register here - dos.lc/codesparta11
